Name: Providing information on wheelchair repair providers.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing information on wheelchair repair providers
BodyName: Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction

History.Description: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction

Attachments.Name: Minutes of the Stated Meeting - August 15, 2024

Summary: This bill would require the Mayor’s Office for People with Disabilities (MOPD) to publish on its website a list of wheelchair repair providers in the city, updated at least once annually. When feasible, the list must include each provider’s name, address, email, phone number, website, hours of operation, accepted insurance, and accepted payment methods. The Department of Health and Mental Hygiene must post a link to this list on its website, and 311 must provide the MOPD link in response to public inquiries about locating wheelchair repair providers.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Chapter 8 of title 23 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 23-807 to read as follows: 
      � 23-807 List of wheelchair repair providers. a. Definitions. For purposes of this section, the following terms have the following meanings: 
      Office. The term "office" means the office established under executive order number 73 for the year 2021 or any successor office or agency that carries out the same or substantially similar functions.
      Wheelchair repair provider. The term "wheelchair repair provider" means a person that repairs a wheelchair in return for payment or free of charge.  
      b. The office shall post on its website a list of wheelchair repair providers that operate in the city. The office may compile such list based on information from other agencies about persons in the city that provide services or sell or lease products for persons with disabilities. The office shall update such list no less than once each year. Where practicable, such list shall include the following information for each wheelchair repair provider:
      1. Name;
      2. Address;
      3. Email address;
      4. Phone number; 
      5. Website domain name; 
      6. Hours of operation; 
      7. Insurance providers accepted, if any; and
      8. Forms of payment accepted.

      c. The department of health and mental hygiene shall post on its website a link to the list the office creates pursuant to subdivision b. 
      d. The 311 customer service center shall provide, in response to a request from the public for information regarding how to locate wheelchair repair providers, a link to the list the office posts pursuant to subdivision b. 
      � 2. This local law takes effect 180 days after it becomes law. 

KF/SOS
LS #16886/16887
11/17/25 4pm
      2
